title: Strengthening Mathematical Competencies through Emotion-Based Project Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Learners are adults with professional backgrounds studying in limited-technology environments (primarily smartphones). The course is designed to analyze emotions experienced during learning and apply these insights to future studies

learning_goals: Learners can structure and explain emotions experienced during project implementation through narrative analysis.
Learners can analyze emotional experiences using the Critical Incident Technique (CIT) and develop future learning strategies.
Learners can establish emotion management strategies through peer feedback and reflection, improving math problem-solving efficiency by over 20%.
Learners can develop protocols to resolve emotional conflicts arising in team-based projects.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
